meanings.definition: Warned or made aware of potential danger or problem.
meanings.sent1: She alerted her friend about the icy road ahead.
meanings.sent2: The lifeguard alerted the swimmers about the strong currents.
meanings.sent3: The cat alerted the family about the approaching thunderstorm by meowing loudly.
meanings.sent4: The smoke alarm alerted the residents to the fire in the building.
meanings.sent5: The flashing lights and sirens alerted everyone to the emergency situation.

meanings.definition: Made ready or prepared for action.
meanings.sent1: The alert firefighter quickly responded to the call.
meanings.sent2: The soldiers were on alert and ready for any incoming threats.
meanings.sent3: The alert squirrel gathered extra nuts for the winter.
meanings.sent4: The alert student studied diligently for the upcoming exam.
meanings.sent5: The alert dog stood guard at the entrance, ready to protect the house.

meanings.definition: Notified or informed about a situation.
meanings.sent1: He alerted his colleagues about the change in meeting time.
meanings.sent2: The weather forecast alerted the residents about the incoming storm.
meanings.sent3: The chirping birds alerted the hiker to the presence of a nearby waterfall.
meanings.sent4: The ringing phone alerted her to the arrival of an important call.
meanings.sent5: The loud noise from the construction site alerted the neighborhood to the ongoing work.
